column5: Hi all, Went back to a trout and whitefish lake for the third time in the past couple of weeks. Thought I'd figured out that the whitefish bite early and the trout from around 9 am onwards. The whitefish were there but back to being aggressively curious but nothing else, mostly window shoppers, might be that when I did good on whitefish it was clear sky high pressure day as this last trip out was a warm, windy low pressure front day, any way, keeping track of weather conditions as I play around with the whitefish. The trout however turned on big time, managed to land three with a couple getting off and lots of chasers that didn't hit. By midday I was starting to pack up, again not bad for a four hour or so session. I decided to try for walleye before going home and got to another lake closer to home at around 3pm. Man had the wind picked up, but it was warm and because I wanted to hole hop for a better chance of a fish decided not to set the shelter up. The walleye gave me the run around, a couple of missed bites, a couple hooked but got off and landed a 19"er. All in all a fun day with plenty of action early on, slept well last night....lol.VIDEOhttps://youtu.be/Bb975rZzkdU
Love the videos! Thanks for making them and posting them for us to view!!
Greetings, Limey: Nice videos of late. Thank you for sharing them. Don't you have a trip coming up to a place that is warm? Kindest regards....
Thanks for watching bearfvr, I get a lot of satisfaction making them and even more so when others enjoy them.
Yeah, not this year. We are headed to London, England to visit family, it will be warmer than here but the fishing SUCKS!

Greetings, Hey Limey: We lived in London for most of a year, about twenty five years ago. I have this recollection that every taxi cab in London had its brakes done in the same repair shop. It seemed to me that every taxi cab sounded as though they had the same squealing brakes. I also remember the smell of the diesel fumes from the buses. On the other hand, we enjoyed visiting the theaters on the West Side of London, as well as the numerous museums and libraries. London is a nice city, but it's still a big city. I much prefer to visit Ontario on a regular basis rather than returning to London. As far as fishing goes, I thought there was a big pond just down the River Thames! I remember touring about weekends in the north of England. The trout/salmon streams and rivers were very scenic, but I understand that they were not available to the public for fishing. Kindest regards....
